definitions.definition: One who makes observations, monitors or takes notice
definitions.example: Most impartial observers agreed that Sampras had not served well.

definitions.definition: One who adheres or follows laws, guidelines, etc.
definitions.example: I shall be an observer of the local customs.

definitions.definition: A person sent as a representative, to a meeting or other function to monitor but not to participate
definitions.example: The UN sent many observers to the country's first elections.

definitions.definition: A country or other entity which has limited participation rights within an organization.
definitions.example: The Vatican and Palestine have observer status at the UN.

definitions.definition: A crew member on an aircraft who makes observations of enemy positions or aircraft
definitions.example: The only crew-member to survive the crash was the Canadian observer.

definitions.definition: A sentry etc. manning an observation post
definitions.example: We waited till dusk when the observers' vision was poorest.
